newsitem.title: USA: Canadian spot natgas prices ease for the weekend.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot natgas prices ease for the weekend.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices were talked a few cents lower for the weekend despite below-normal temperatures in the West, with gas backing into Alberta still undermining values, traders said.
Spot gas at the AECO storage hub fell more than five cents to the C$1.65-1.70 per gigajoule range, while 30-day and summer Aeco were quoted near C$1.70 per GJ, little changed from Thursday.
"There's some gas backing into the province, so the market is a little softer," one Calgary-based trader said.
But traders said storage still lagged year-ago levels, particularly in the West, and steady injection demand should limit any price slide.
Canadian Gas Association said Friday that Canadian gas stocks rose last week by 14.1 percent to 93.93 bcf. Western storage was 26.7 percent full, well-below last year's level of 37.1 percent full.
Export prices at Sumas were talked a few cents lower in the mid-to-high $1.30s per million British thermal units (mmBtu).
At Niagara in eastern Canada, prices were pegged slightly lower in the high-$2.30s.
